snippet.title: Kyle Sandilands' shock confession to Eddie McGuire: 'I'm 135 kilos Eddie - help me'
snippet.content:
Kyle Sandilands tells Eddie McGuire he's 135 kilos 0:28
KIIS FM host Kyle Sandilands tells Eddie McGuire he's 135 kilos and needs help. Video: KIIS 1065 FM
August 7th 2017 6 hours ago /display/newscorpaustralia.com/Web/NewsNetwork/Entertainment - syndicated/
Kyle Sandilands has begged Eddie McGuire for help to lose weight.
Share
KIIS FM shock jock Kyle Sandilands has revealed he has tipped the scales at 135 kilograms before asking media personality Eddie McGuire for help. McGuire after revealing he had shed a whopping 20kg in a matter of weeks following an extreme diet. The intensive 12-week program is based on Chinese herbs and involves not eating or drinking anything other than three cups of herb tonic a day for the first two weeks.
Kyle Sandilands. Picture: Jonathan NgSource:News Corp Australia
Kyle Sandilands arrives at KIIS studios. Picture: John GraingerSource:News Corp Australia During an on-air interview on the Kyle and Jackie O Show, Sandilands, 46, told McGuire: "I'm 135 kilos Eddie - help me." "It does take a bit of mental strength to get through but I found it relatively easy going," McGuire told the hosts, detailing his diet. "You have the herbs but also you go and get the acupuncture and a massage for the first couple of weeks and also get weighed in everyday so that gets you a bit honest."
Eddie McGuire in 2015. Picture: Julie KiriacoudisSource:News Corp Australia
Eddie McGuire now.Source:Getty Images "You're probably the same Kyle, you've probably put on a kilo-and-a-half or two kilos every year." Sandilands is shown holding up five fingers to his co-host Jackie O. "You reckon I put on five (kilos) a year Jackie?" he was heard asking, which she nods in agreement. "Jesus."
Eddie McGuire and Rebecca Maddern. Picture: Alex Coppel.Source:News Corp Australia McGuire responded by complimenting Sandilands, describing him as a "strong-minded bloke." "You get belligerent like I did and when everyone starts pushing food in front of you, offering you drinks or saying you weren't working and then when it's all done they say, 'You're a plonk of fat'," he added. Sandilands quipped "I'm in" when McGuire said people were allowed to smoke during the diet.
